name: Trevor Crosby, Ph.D.
label: Data & Machine Learning Scientist
summary: AI/ML leader with experience building production-grade machine learning systems to solve complex challenges at scale.

highlights: Developed product that delivers low-latency similarity searches of industry entities by leveraging vector databases to facilitate retrieval of embeddings using high-dimensional distance calculations.
Applied transformer deep learning models and convolutional neural networks to embed unstructured multimodal data (ie. satellite imagery, written observations, machine sensor readings) at scale.
Engineered agentic workflow to consolidate many products' access points into single, LLM-driven entryway.
Designed tool to use customer similarity to personalize product value proposals.

Communicated and visualized project goals and progress with technical and non-technical stakeholders, mentored part-time student, and performed as technical lead in a diverse, geographically distributed group.

Adapted geospatial and biological data in creating classifier and regressor to predict population dynamics and crop impact of a major agricultural pest at sub-field-level resolution, mitigating its multi-billion dollar impact.

Automated data extraction and cleaning, feature engineering, model assessment and validation, and script testing for ML products, significantly reducing product update cycles and operational overhead.
Co-developed modular codebase for using distance metrics to cull product recommendations based on customer profiles, product features, and regional factors, reducing product choices by 90%.

work_experience.company: University of Wisconsin-Madison, Department of Horticulture
highlights: Designed research to assess hyperspectral and multispectral remote sensing and dimensionality reduction in developing ML tools to enhance spatial and temporal precision in crop management decision-making.
Led cross-functional team in creating partial least-squares regression-focused algorithms that predict mid- and post-season crop yield, quality, and fertility to improve agronomic efficiency.
Applied ML models to inform product application using multispectral drone images and environmental data.

volunteer_experience.summary: Coordinated and led biweekly data professionals meetup, growing community membership and fostering meaningful connections.
Led whiteboarding lectures on ML, data science, and software engineering topics. Some lecture highlights are:

skills.name: Python, SQL, Git, PyTorch, scikit-learn, Spark, Databricks, GenAI, LLMs, CVML, Vector Databases, CI/CD, Agile
